description: An HTML webpage for AP Statistics Unit 2, providing learning resources including a guided learning flow, an interactive flowchart, a prompt for an AI tutor (Grok), and downloadable study materials (PDFs, video links). The page uses Tailwind CSS for styling, React for the learning flow component, Mermaid.js for the flowchart, and extensive vanilla JavaScript for dynamic content updates, tab management, and progress tracking via local storage.

libraries.name: React
libraries.purpose: JavaScript library for building user interfaces (used for the Learning Flow tab).

libraries.name: ReactDOM
libraries.purpose: Entry point to the DOM and server renderers for React.

libraries.name: Babel Standalone
libraries.purpose: Transpiles JSX (used in the React component) in the browser.

libraries.name: Mermaid JS
libraries.purpose: Renders diagrams and flowcharts from text-based definitions.

inlineStyles.purpose: Displays the active tab content pane.
Basic styling for tab navigation buttons.
Styling for the currently active tab button.
CSS animation to highlight a selected topic card briefly.
Visual indication (opacity, overlay) when all topics are completed.
Special border/shadow for the capstone topic card when all topics are completed.

head.title: AP Statistics Unit 2: Exploring Two-Variable Data
head.scripts: Links to external libraries (Tailwind, React, ReactDOM, Babel, Mermaid)
head.styles: Inline CSS for tab control and custom effects.

tabs.name: Learning Flow
tabs.description: Displays an interactive, step-by-step guide for a learning session using the provided resources. Implemented as a React component.

tabs.name: Flowchart
tabs.description: Shows a visual flowchart of the recommended learning process using Mermaid.js.

tabs.name: Grok Prompt
tabs.description: Provides a pre-written prompt for the Grok AI tutor, instructions on how to use it with downloaded PDFs, displays the current topic's materials, and offers quick access to all topics.

content.videoBackupInfo: Text explaining the (+) symbol for video backups.

tabs.name: Study Materials
tabs.description: Lists all Unit 2 topics with links to download question/answer PDFs and watch associated videos (AP Classroom + Google Drive backups). Allows users to track their progress.

content.grokPromptCTA: Banner encouraging use of the Grok Prompt tab.
content.videoBackupInfo: Text explaining the (+) symbol for video backups.

dataSources.name: flowchartDefinition (constant)
dataSources.purpose: Defines the structure of the flowchart.

dataSources.name: grokPrompt (constant)
dataSources.purpose: Holds the text for the Grok AI tutor prompt.

dataSources.name: pdfFiles (constant array)
dataSources.purpose: Central data structure defining each topic's details (ID, name, description, PDF paths, video URLs, completion status, current status, capstone status). Drives the content of 'Study Materials' and 'Grok Prompt' tabs.
dataSources.persistence: Completion and current status are loaded from and saved to localStorage.

javascriptFunctions.name: createTopicCard
javascriptFunctions.purpose: Generates HTML for a topic card based on pdfFiles data and status.

javascriptFunctions.name: updateProgressBar
javascriptFunctions.purpose: Updates the width and text of #progress-bar.

javascriptFunctions.name: checkAllTopicsCompleted
javascriptFunctions.purpose: Checks if all topics in pdfFiles are marked complete. Shows/hides #all-completed-container.

javascriptFunctions.name: resetProgress
javascriptFunctions.purpose: Resets completion status in pdfFiles, saves to localStorage, and updates UI.

javascriptFunctions.name: markTopicAsCompleted
javascriptFunctions.purpose: Updates a topic's status in pdfFiles, saves, updates UI (cards, progress bar, current topic). Exposed globally.
javascriptFunctions.triggeredBy: Buttons within dynamically generated topic cards (`onclick="markTopicAsCompleted(...)"`) and `#complete-current-topic-btn`.

javascriptFunctions.name: saveTopicProgress
javascriptFunctions.purpose: Saves topic completion/current status from pdfFiles to localStorage.

javascriptFunctions.name: loadTopicProgress
javascriptFunctions.purpose: Loads topic status from localStorage into pdfFiles.

javascriptFunctions.name: updateCurrentTopicInfo
javascriptFunctions.purpose: Updates the #current-topic-info section in the Grok Prompt tab based on the 'current' topic in pdfFiles. Manages the state/action of #complete-current-topic-btn.

javascriptFunctions.name: populateQuickAccessTopics
javascriptFunctions.purpose: Populates #quick-access-topics in the Grok Prompt tab with clickable topic summaries.

javascriptFunctions.name: setTopicAsCurrent
javascriptFunctions.purpose: Updates the 'current' topic in pdfFiles based on user interaction in the Grok Prompt tab quick access list.

DOMContentLoaded: Sets up tab switching logic (adding/removing 'active' classes, triggering renders/updates for specific tabs).
Attaches click listener to #copy-button for clipboard functionality.
Loads initial progress and populates relevant tabs.
eventHandling.Tab Button Clicks: Switches active tab and content pane, triggers relevant updates (e.g., Mermaid render, topic card population).
eventHandling.Copy Button Click: Copies text from #grok-prompt to clipboard, provides visual feedback.
eventHandling.Topic Select Change: Scrolls the view to the selected topic card in the Study Materials tab.
eventHandling.Quick Access Topic Click (Grok Tab): Calls `setTopicAsCurrent` to change the focused topic.

topicProgress.dataStored: Array of {id, completed, current, videoUrls} for each topic.

reactComponent.name: APStatLearningFlow
reactComponent.description: A functional React component displaying a multi-step learning guide.

state.currentStep: Managed using React.useState, determines which step's content is displayed.

data.steps: Hardcoded array of objects, each defining a step's title, icon, content, tips, and color.

functionality: Uses icons and color-coding for different phases (Setup, Video, Practice, Progress).
Provides 'Previous Step' and 'Next Step' buttons for navigation.
Includes a static list of required materials.
reactComponent.styling: Uses Tailwind CSS classes, dynamically applies color classes based on step color.
